text: I'm a driven person.
I see something new, I get curious.
I go try it.
And if it suits me, I just get into it.
It's kind of my thing.
My name is Vani Agarwal, and I'm an AWS

AI & ML Scholarship
student in Greater Noida, India.

I want to be a mentor
for the next generation of women

that are going into
artificial intelligence.

What drew me to this whole 
field was just pure curiosity.

Originally, when I 
applied to the scholarship,

it was because I had heard
the buzz around it.

I registered on the portal
and wrote a huge application for myself.

And one day there was this email
that says, "Congratulations,

you have been accepted into the AWS
AI & ML Scholarship program."
The Nanodegree has definitely unlocked
my interest in AI specifically.
It was the module that introduced

neural networks because the basic concept
of artificial intelligence,

it is mimicking the human brain
and neural networks do the exact same.

There's a machine and you are trying
to make it learn something.
It is definitely something I would like
to pursue in the future, that's for sure.

I've had some wonderful women
supporting me throughout this whole thing,

and it's great to have this 
type of support in your life.
Trying to make a human brain–

I would love to show the next generation
that if they need someone to give them

advice, to mentor them, to guide them,
I am here and I'm ready to listen.

This is the simplest type of regulation–
You know, appreciating someone's hard work,

acknowledging their 
efforts is the bare minimum

you can do for someone
to make them feel valued.

If someone's
considering to apply to the AWS

AI & ML Scholarship program,
I'm definitely going to recommend it.
There are milestones to achieve.
There are projects to complete.

It's a holistic overall development
which is kind of hard to come by.

So it's definitely something
that if it's within your reach, grab it.
